all_procs.procedure_1.csv:
item,phasetype,survey,max_time,text,notes,shuffle_1,shuffle_2,task_title,task_body_text,weight, 0,offline,,user,,,off,off,STUDY TEMPORARILY OFFLINE,We're really sorry but the study isn't available at the moment. The program used to run this study has had an update which has broken the data storage within this study. We are very sorry that you cannot complete the study at this time.,0, 0,intro_static,,user,Welcome,no_mobile,off,off,,,0, 0,tp_multimedia,,user,,,off,off,,,0, 0,zoom_check,,user,,,off,off,,,0, 0,tp_infoconsent,,user,Curse Words and the Clock: How Expletives Alter Our Sense of Time,,off,off,,,0, 0,task_bookend,,user,Next,,off,off,Demographics,"

Before you begin, we need you to complete a brief demographics questionnaire. we require is to just collect some basic demographic information about you so we can better understand who has taken part in our study.


When you are ready, please press Next to begin.

",0, 0,tde_survey,tp_demo.csv,user,50,,off,off,,,, 0,task_bookend,,user,Start,,off,off,Time Peception,"

In this study we are interested in how people's perception of time passing changes within a situation.

For the next task, each trial begins with a cross in the centre of the screen, please focus on this. It will then be replaced by a written word while, at the same time, you will hear a second word read out loud. Once the spoken word has been read out, the word on the screen will be replaced with a straight line and you will hear a constant audio tone. This tone will either last for 1.5 seconds (i.e., a long period) or 0.5 seconds (i.e., a short period). The tone will only be one of these two options. When the tone ends, the initial pair of words you saw/heard will be repeated. Once that repetition been completed, you will then be presented with two response buttons.

All you have to do is state whether the audio tone you heard lasted for a long (i.e., 1.5 seconds) or short (i.e., 0.5 seconds) period of time.

You will now complete a number of training trials so you can learn the difference between a long and short audio tone before the main experimental trials begin. These trials do not include swear words.

When you are ready to start, please press 'Start' below.

",, 402 to 441,tp_training,,user,,,Training,off,,,, 0,task_bookend,,user,Start,,off,off,End of training trials,"

You are about to start the main experimental trials. These include swear words.

These trials are exactly the same as the training trials you have just completed except:

(1) The length of the audio tone between the words now differs
(2) Some trials do not have a spoken or written word before/after the audio tone.

Once again, you simply have to listen how long the tone lasts for. But, you then need to decide if it was closer in length to the 'long' or 'short' trials from the training phase you just completed. If you think it was closer to the 0.5 second 'short' tone, click the 'Short' button but if you think it was closer to the 1.5 seconds 'long' tone, click the 'Long' button.

As a reminder: you will initially see a cross in the centre of the screen (which you should focus on). The cross may then be replaced by a written word and you may hear another word read out. After this, a horizontal line will appear on screen and a single audio tone will play. When the tone stops, any initial written or spoken words will be repeated. You will then be given the same two response buttons (short and long).

The task is broken up into several blocks of trials and you will be given the option of a break between blocks. When you are ready to start the experimental trials, please click 'Start' below.

",, 2 to 101,tp_maintask,,user,,,Experiment,Block 1,,,, 0,task_bookend,,user,Continue,,off,off,Time For A Break,"

Thank you for completing the first block, you may now have a break if you wish. When you are ready to start the next block please press Continue below.

",, 102 to 201,tp_maintask,,user,,,Experiment,Block 2,,,, 0,task_bookend,,user,Continue,,off,off,Time For A Break,"

Thank you for completing the second block, you may now have a break if you wish. When you are ready to start the next block please press Continue below.

",, 202 to 301,tp_maintask,,user,,,Experiment,Block 3,,,, 0,task_bookend,,user,Continue,,off,off,Time For A Break,"

Thank you for completing the third block, you may now have a break if you wish. When you are ready to start the final block please press Continue below.

",, 302 to 401,tp_maintask,,user,,,Experiment,Block 4,,,, 0,task_bookend,,user,Next,,off,off,End of Experimental Trials,"

Thank you for completing the fourth block, you have now completed all blocks within this task. When you are ready, please press Next to move to the next task in the study.

",, 442 to 481,tp_valence,,user,,,Valence,off,,,, 0,task_bookend,,user,Continue,,off,off,End of Valence Ratings,"

Thank you for completing the valence ratings. When you are ready, please press Next to move to the next task in the study.

",, 442 to 481,tp_arousal,,user,,,Arousal,off,,,, 0,tp_dataquality,,user,,,off,off,Audio Level Check,Thank you for making the previous ratings. We now just need to record the audio level you used during the study so that we can control for any effect of different audio levels between participants from affecting our results. To run this check simply click the button below.,, 0,upload_data,,12,,Uploading REDCap Markers,off,off,,,, 0,tp_debrief,,user,Curse Words and the Clock: How Expletives Alter Our Sense of Time,,off,off,,,,

conditions:
name,notes,stimuli,procedure,fullscreen,welcome,participant_id,skip_quality,zoom_check,buffer,progress_bar,mobile, timeperception,this is just a backup of Jiewei's study in case we need it,stimuli_1.csv,procedure_1.csv,on,"Thank you for taking part in this study. Before we begin, however, there are some pre-study checks that we just need to run through.

This study requires you listen to audio stimuli and one of the checks is to ensure that your computer has working audio. While you can use your computer's speakers, we would recommend you use headphones/ear buds when you complete this study so you don't disturb others around you. You also require a physical keyboard as you will required to provide task responses by pressing the spacebar.

When you are ready to begin the pre-study checks, please press 'Start' below.",random,yes,no,5,stimuli,no,

Demographic Information



Please could you help us better understand the diversity and inclusivity of our participants (and thus how well our data is applicable to the general population) by completing the questions below.

All questions are optional, you do not have to answer if you wish, if that is the case please select "Prefer not to say". It really does help us, however, if you could answer the questions.

1. Please enter your age (in years)
(the input only accepts numbers e.g., 21)
4. What is the highest level of education you have completed?
GCSEs or equivalent|A-Levels or equivalent|Undergraduate (e.g., BSc)|Postgraduate (e.g., MSc)|Doctoral degree|Other|Prefer not to say
5. What is your current employment status?
Full-time employment|Part-time employment|Unemployed/Retired/Full-time education|Prefer not to say

6. Are you a native British English Speaker
(defined as being born and raised in the UK, or moved to the UK before the age of 2)
7. How often do you hear swearwords in your daily life?
8. How often do you use swearwords yourself?
9. How often do you the people around you (e.g., family, friends, and colleagues) use swearwords?
